refnamediv.refpurpose: This statement may be used to mark the end of the last section of the score.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This statement may be used to mark the end of the last section of the score.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: The first p-field time is optional and if present determines the end time (length in beats) of the final section of the score. This time must be after the end of the last event otherwise it will have no effect. "Always on" instruments will end at the given time. Extending the section in this way is useful to avoid prematurely cutting off reverb tails or other effects.

refsect2.title: Special Considerations
refsect2.para: The e statement is contextually identical to an s statement. Additionally, the e statement terminates all signal generation (including indefinite performance) and closes all input and output files.
If an e statement occurs before the end of a score, all subsequent score lines will be ignored.
The e statement is optional in a score file yet to be sorted. If a score file has no e statement, then Sort processing will supply one.
